comments.content: Any thoughts on how to make the mushroom "bacon"?

comments.author: roopa
comments.content: Ohhhh I am so jealous. However, I have a date (with my mom!) at Dirt Candy in a few weeks, and they do a very similar stone-ground grits dish (Stone Ground Grits, pickled shitakes and a tempura poached egg) that is supposedly amazing. And don't you find it overwhelming when you have the entire menu to choose from? I've been a vegetarian since birth so I'm completely accustomed to having only 1 or 2 (or commonly in the past, no) choices; when I go to vegetarian restaurants, my head spins!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Dirt Candy looks good! First I'd heard of it, definitely on my list if I ever make it to NYC. It really *is* confusing to be able to choose from the whole menu, isn't it?

comments.author: jellyfish
comments.content: Great review. And I too would love to see an adaptation of the mushroom bacon if you feel like taking on a new project! :)

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: I wish I knew how to make that "bacon"! I'd assume it involves some combination of dehydrating, smoking, and basting with the maple syrup butI imagine it would be tricky to get it exactly right.

comments.author: A&N
comments.content:
This is so on my list!

And about choosing, my husband and I check the menu before hand and fight over it :D and figure out who is taking what and try to cover the whole thing!

comments.author: cocochanelella
comments.content: This has been on my wish list, I find it amazing too that the whole menu is uncooked and vegan. Sounds like a fun time.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Just to be clear, the menu at Ubuntu has many vegan options but *not* much uncooked...

comments.author: Eric Flescher
comments.content: Nice review. I am also jewish (as is my wife). I just made the chef's now famous cauliflower in cast iron skillet and it was fantastic- very different. I hope to try more. His cookbook is coming out soon I hear.

comments.author: Steve
comments.content: We also enjoyed Ubuntu - a delicious and unique dining experience: http://thought2form.blogspot.com/2010/08/ubuntu-restaurant-napa-ca_19.html

comments.author: Kelly Bone
comments.content:
I've begrudgingly eaten gruel-like egg and grits throughout the country (mostly because in some areas is the only decent vegetarian breakfast option), but this look absolutely fantastic... a excellent argument against the ideas that a traditional food must be served in a traditional style.

Plus, who doesn't love a vegetarian restaurant what is Michelin star worthy (despite the fact that the Fox has fled the kitchen)!
